par.text: Germanium is a silvery-grey, hard and brittle metalloid. At elevated temperatures it reacts with oxygen to form germanium(IV) oxide – Ge

. The existence of germanium and its properties was predicted in 1871 by Dmitri Mendeleyev, who called the hypothetical element ekasilicon. Germanium was discovered in 1886 by the German chemist Clemens Alexander Winkler.
